scenarios.title: Distributor Squeeze on Gross-to-Net
scenarios.brief: Your #1 distributor demands either a 3pp list price cut or 5pp structural allowances for 8 weeks. Protect contribution margin while avoiding stock-outs on I4 and V6 flagship SKUs.
objectives: Choose pricing vs allowance vs hybrid strategy.
Keep service level ≥ 95% on top SKUs.
Maintain ending cash balance ≥ prior month.
tips: Working capital moves can offset short-term margin pressure.

scenarios.title: APAC Castings Lead-Time Slip
scenarios.brief: Custom castings lead-times slip by 2–4 weeks. You can expedite at a premium or rebalance mix to avoid stock-outs on high-margin builds.
objectives: Decide expedite budget vs mix replan.
Avoid stock-outs on I4 and Hybrid motors.
Hold gross margin within 50 bps of baseline.
tips: Expedite cost is P&L now; stock-out has revenue and customer impact.
Use safety stock rules pragmatically, not dogmatically.

scenarios.title: Freight Spike on Transatlantic
scenarios.brief: Spot freight on the transatlantic lane jumps 12% MoM. Decide whether to pull forward shipments or wait it out while meeting a new EU promo window.
objectives: Balance freight cost vs promo revenue timing.
Keep DSO flat while hitting windowed demand.
tips: Freight is part of gross-to-net for many orgs—treat it explicitly.
Pulling forward affects working capital and cash.

scenarios.title: Warranty Signal on V6 Batch
scenarios.brief: Field failure rate suggests a potential warranty exposure on one V6 batch. Estimate reserve, decide whether to pause shipments, and communicate to distributors.
tips: Accrual hits margin now; cash impact may be lagged.
Use sensitivity ranges and scenario labels in your brief.

scenarios.title: EUR Strengthens vs USD
scenarios.brief: EUR appreciates 4% vs USD into month-end. You sell in both currencies. Decide pricing buffers, hedging stance, and forecast translation impact.
objectives: Protect local price integrity without whiplash.
Quantify FX translation on revenue and COGS.
tips: Pricing cadence ≠ FX tick-by-tick; avoid ping-pong.
Disclose FX impacts cleanly: revenue, COGS, gross margin.

scenarios.title: Top Customer Slows Payments
scenarios.brief: Your largest customer stretches terms by ~20 days. Decide on credit policy, potential factoring, or partial hold, while avoiding channel conflict.
objectives: Avoid burning the relationship unless necessary.
tips: Cash lives on the balance sheet — show the movement.
Consider carrot/stick: early-pay discounts vs holds.
